discourse_list.title: What happened to the Liquidations 2.0 GUI

content.content: I tried to use https://liquidations.makerdao.com during the market crash but I got an error message saying “Unable to fetch system data at this time” what exactly happened? Also, I understand that there is open source keeper software, would that have been usable at that time, if so can someone share the link to it.  ough2956×938 167 KB

We experienced strong pikes in our Infura requests for the UI that we are maintaining (Auctions UI). My suspicion is that the Liq 2.0 portal faced same problems and potentially exceeded its Infura quota which resulted in not being able to fetch auction data any longer for some time. Maybe @0xdeniz has more insights on that.

I can share some more insights  The liquidations portal displayed a 403 (forbidden) response due to the Graphql API being unavailable. Through collaborating with the TechOps team we found that the API was unavailable due to the high number of complex queries that were posted to it yesterday (due to high traffic and lots of liquidations happening). TechOps was able to quickly upgrade the server that hosts the service, which resolved the issue. Even though we are not explicitly responsible for the Liquidations Portal we defined some potential improvements that would decrease the load on such APIs—we’ll look into how to get those implemented. These UIs lack explicit ownership currently so we’re happy that SAS was onboarded recently to cover these grounds.

One thing I was wondering; were you able to participate in the auctions? I explained the cause of the error you referred to (the system stats section being unavailable) but this should not have inhibited participation in the auction that’s shown in your screenshot. Hope to hear from you, thanks
No, I could just sit and watch as eth got sold at ridiculously low prices. I couldn’t even deposit Dai!
On further inspection, I may have just run into the same problem that I had trying to withdrawal my Dai I wrote about here More porblams with liquidation auctions
I’ll reply in the new thread you started.
For context; I shared some comments on the state of auction UIs. Check it out here: On the State of the Auctions UIs
